title: Georgia gets 'down and dirty,' KO's Texas in 4th
content: The No. 5 Bulldogs once again bullied the No. 10 Longhorns, delivering the knockout blow by outscoring Texas 21-0 in the fourth quarter to win 35-10.

title: White: Danis banned from UFC after MSG brawl
content: The UFC has banned Dillon Danis from future events after he and members of Islam Makhachev's team were involved in a brawl at Madison Square Garden during UFC 322.

title: Giannis steps in to secure game ball for L.A. rookie
content: Noticing some postgame confusion at center court, Bucks star Giannis Antetokounmpo intervened by securing the game ball and handing it to the Lakers to present to rookie teammate Adou Thiero.

title: Giants urging Dart to modify running approach
content: People both inside and outside the Giants organization have urged Jaxson Dart to be more thoughtful and careful with when and how he runs.

title: OU shakes up SEC, CFP with upset of No. 4 Tide
content: Oklahoma sent shock waves through the SEC and revived its CFP hopes by forcing three Alabama turnovers and getting a key stop late in a 23-21 upset in Tuscaloosa.

title: Kiffin on Gators rumors after win: 'I love' Ole Miss
content: Amid rumors Lane Kiffin is the top candidate for the Gators' open head coaching job, the Ole Miss coach said he "loves" being with the Rebels after their comeback win.

title: Rory loses playoff to Fitzpatrick, wins Euro title
content: Rory McIlroy holed an eagle putt on No. 18 to force a playoff but lost out to Matt Fitzpatrick, who won the World Tour Championship for a third time

title: S. Carolina claims 1st 'Real SC' title in win vs. USC
content: South Carolina claimed the inaugural title of "The Real SC" by beating USC in a game the Gamecocks hope they can build upon.

title: Ready for NFL Week 11? We have sleepers, QB questions, trends to watch and more
content: Big game coming for Aaron Rodgers? Matchup questions for the Seahawks and Rams? An edge for Jared Goff against the Eagles? Catch up on Week 11.

title: Just two guys from the middle of the Pacific: Tua, Mariota renew friendship in Madrid
content: Marcus Mariota and Tua Tagovailoa mark a special moment: starting against each other in an NFL game in Madrid.

title: Fireworks for Massachusetts, down 42, top college football superlatives
content: The Minutemen's fourth-quarter field goal to cut into Northern Illinois' blowout lead produced an unfortunately viral fireworks display in Week 12.

title: Week 11 inactives: Status for Matthew Golden, Davante Adams and others
content: Updated inactives and analysis based on the latest reports and official announcements leading up to kickoff.

title: Reyna takes advantage of opportunity in return, as USMNT continues unbeaten run
content: Gio Reyna had a chance to redeem himself and make it to the USMNT's World Cup squad next year and he took full advantage in its 2-1 win against Paraguay.

title: Perseverance leads Washington to another NWSL Championship final
content: Washington's experience from last year's NWSL Championship heartbreak is paying off as the Spirit brushed aside Portland to reach back-to-back finals.

title: NFL Week 11 odds: Chiefs road favorites at Broncos, Seahawks slight 'dogs at Rams
content: Week 11 features several big matchups. Here are the odds, spreads and totals for every NFL game this weekend.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona, Bayern, Man United fight for Vlahovic
content: Juventus striker Dusan Vlahovic has Barcelona, Bayern Munich, Manchester United, Tottenham Hotspur and Atlético Madrid on his trail. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: AP-CRDA inks 35 MoUs worth ₹49,093 crore at CII Partnership Summit
content: Agreements span urban mobility, infrastructure, tourism, energy, education, and IT exports as Minister P. Narayana highlights Amaravati’s development under the land pooling model

title: Activist Vatal Nagaraj stages ‘Save Forests’ demonstration in Mysuru
content: Vatal Nagaraj has alleged that no efforts were being made to protect the forests that were being destroyed across the State

title: CPI(M) criticises Chief Minister Naidu over remarks against Visakhapatnam Steel Plant workers
content: The party State Secretary says linking wages to production deepens worker uncertainty and rejects the Chief Minister’s claims on VSP’s finances

title: Shashi Tharoor condemns Assam Minister’s controversial ‘Gobi farming’ post
content: Ashok Singhal’s “Bihar approves Gobi farming” post with cauliflower field image evoked a strong response from people who said the image was an apparent reference to the 1989 Bhagalpur violence in Bihar

title: Chikkamagaluru district administration impose restrictions in view of Datta Jayanti programme in Bababudangiri
content: On the first day, the devotees would reach the town on December 2, wearing Datta Mala. The next day, they would take out a procession in the town. The celebration would culminate with a visit to the shrine atop Bababudangiri

title: BRS urges government to pace up paddy procurement, payment of bills
content: Bills totalling ₹1,200 crore against paddy sale by farmers, another ₹200 crore towards bonus amount are pending payment, says BRS leader Harish Rao

title: KPS Scheme is yet another ploy to merge or close down existing govt. schools, says AIDSO
content: All India Democratic Students Organisation has strongly condemned the State govt. decision to implement the Karnataka Public Schools Scheme

title: KTR hits out at Centre, State government on cotton procurement
content: CCI had purchased only 1.12 lakh tonnes of cotton so far and it was alarmingly low compared to the season’s projected production of 28.29 lakh tonnes, says BRS working president

title: Puttaparthi geared up for Sathya Sai Baba’s centenary celebrations
content: Collector announces the launch of the ‘SAI 100’ mobile app, which provides daily programme schedules, venue details, among others; over 200 APSRTC special buses have been deployed, with free shuttle services from Puttaparthi railway station to the ashram

title: TNCC president denies Congress holding alliance talks with TVK
content: We have not received any instruction from the party’s central leadership to go in for talks with actor Vijay’s party. We are firmly with the DMK and the INDIA bloc, says K. Selvaperunthagai

title: Hwaseung to invest ₹898 crore in non-leather footwear plant at Kuppam in Andhra Pradesh
content: South Korean giant’s unit to come up on a 100-acre campus; project expected to create 17,645 direct jobs as Andhra Pradesh steps up global manufacturing push

title: Jagan slams NDA government over slow revenue growth in Andhra Pradesh
content: YSRCP chief cites CAG data showing muted tax collections and a contraction in capital spending, questioning the Naidu government’s claims of double-digit GSDP growth

title: Bihar poll outcome result of three ‘experiments’, claims Dipankar Bhattacharya
content: CPI(ML), a constituent of the RJD-led Mahagathbandhan, has won just two seats out of the 20 it contested, which is much lower than the 12 out of 19 seats that went into its kitty in the 2020 polls.

title: Congress calls to meet top office-bearers of 12 States, UTs where SIR is underway
content: On Friday (November 14, 2025), Rahul Gandhi called the Bihar poll results surprising and claimed that the election was not fair from the very beginning

title: Jan Suraaj's poll debacle puts spotlight on political ‘startups’ that failed to become ‘unicorns’
content: Former Congress leader and political analyst Sanjay Jha said political 'startups' find it difficult to get going as ideological clarity takes time to accomplish, and claimed that India has become more conservative, less risk-taking, and ossified by conversations on traditionalism.

title: Fake currency notes: Feroke police in search of gang behind five nabbed youngsters
content: According to police sources, the seized fake notes and early evidence pointed to an organised effort to make substantial quantities of fake notes and circulate them for quick returns

title: J&K L-G lauds police for dismantling ‘white-collar’ terror network; pays tributes to Nowgam victims
content: Manoj Sinha said he has already ordered a magisterial probe into Friday (November 14, 2025) night's incident that left nine persons dead and 32 others, mostly police personnel, injured

title: Tirupati police slap PD Act on six criminals
content: The Superintendent of Police L. Subbarayudu announced that the invoking of the PD Act would effectively identify, monitor and control individuals posing a risk to public safety

title: Heavy rainfall likely in Tirupati, SPSR Nellore districts
content: The IMD has issued an orange alert for heavy rainfall in Tirupati and Nellore districts, effective November 17, 2025, due to a low-pressure system in the southwest Bay of Bengal

title: Sugar mills agree to pay ₹2,950 per tonne within 14 days, says Priyank Kharge
content: As per the joint survey by Agriculture, Horticulture and Revenue Departments conducted under NDRF guidelines, crop loss was reported in 3,24,205 hectares.

title: RSS leader's son dead in Punjab's Ferozpur
content: The two unidentified youth who were on a motorcycle arrived and opened fire at Naveen from point-blank range and fled. Naveen was later rushed to a private hospital, where he was declared dead on arrival

title: CJI Gavai backs exclusion of creamy layer in reservation to scheduled castes
content: Justice Gavai opined that children of an IAS officer can not be equated with the offsprings of a poor agricultural labourer when it comes to reservations

title: Better if party high command clarifies on leadership confusion in Karnataka, says Minister Satish Jarkiholi
content: Karnataka Minister Satish Jarkiholi urged the Congress high command to clarify leadership issues in the State, highlighting the need for transparency amid ongoing political uncertainty

title: Congress’s 'vote theft' claims without proof will lead to more poll defeats: Fadnavis
content: The nation continues to place its faith in Prime Minister Narendra Modi, and the people of the country are directly responding to the Opposition's fake narrative, says Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis

title: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar likely to submit resignation on November 17
content: Following the meeting on November 17, NDA Legislative Party meeting would be held to choose the leader of NDA Legislative Party

title: Amit Shah to chair Northern Zonal Council meeting in Faridabad on November 17
content: Zonal Councils provide excellent forum for resolving, progressing issues and disputes between Centre and member States and Union territories, among member States and Union territories, within the Zone, says official statement

title: CPI to stage nationwide protest on November 18 against rising atrocities
content: CPI Kalaburagi district unit will stage a demonstration in front of the Deputy Commissioner’s office on Tuesday (November 18, 2025), says CPI district secretary Dr. Mahesh Kumar Rathod

title: Rohini Acharya again hits out at Tejashwi’s close aides alleging they made her an orphan
content: In an emotional message on social media platform ‘X’, Ms. Acharya said that she did not compromise on her self-respect, neither surrender before the truth, and solely because of hate, she had to endure the insult

title: Last date for paddy crop insurance registration extended to November 30: Minister
content: Farmers had highlighted heavy rains affecting cultivation, and that officials were involved in work relating to the Special Intensive Revision of the electoral rolls.

title: Press must remain the force that keeps democracy alive: Stalin
content: M.K. Stalin emphasises the press’s vital role in safeguarding democracy on National Press Day, urging journalists to resist authoritarianism

title: Police fire at two murder accused in Karnataka’s Hubballi
content: Both the accused persons and some police officers injured in the incident were admitted to the hospital

title: 7-year-old boy dies after getting trapped inside parked car near Madurai
content: Police suspect that the boy, who may have gotten into the parked car, did not know how to open the door and became trapped inside

title: Six killed, 14 injured as vehicle carrying pilgrims collides with trailer in Jodhpur
content: The tempo, carrying around 20 pilgrims from Gujarat's Banaskantha and Dhansura areas and heading to Ramdeora, was hit by the speeding trailer coming from the opposite direction, says Balesar SHO Moolsingh Bhati

title: India shaping development pathways with economically sound and climate-responsible approach: UNDP chief
content: Haoliang Xu said India’s commitment to climate adaptation, renewable energy and inclusive digital finance offers a blueprint for balancing growth with sustainability

title: Suspicious bag causes scare in Nashik; cops find nothing alarming
content: The police received a call that a suspicious object was lying near the Indiranagar underpass, adjacent to the Mumbai-Agra national highway, in the morning, an official said

title: Gauhati High Court seeks reply from Assam govt. on teen’s death in makeshift shelter
content: Aynal Haque, 19, died more than a month after his family was evicted during a drive to clear government land in western Assam’s Goalpara district in June

title: State Election Commission publishes final list, Kerala has a little over 2.86 crore voters
content: The number shows an increase of 2,15,950 from the electoral rolls published on October 25, which was taken as the draft list for a two-day enrollment held on November 4 and November 5

title: Amid students' protests, Panjab University postpones exams
content: University's decision came after protesting students announced that they would boycott exams until the schedule for the Senate polls, which have not been held in over a year

title: Jaishankar discusses bilateral partnership, regional developments with Bahraini FM over call
content: They also agreed to develop a common understanding to commence negotiations for a double taxation avoidance agreement (DTAA)

title: Bihar Assembly polls: ₹14,000 from World Bank was diverted for elections, says Jan Suraaj leader
content: The amount of ₹10,000 given to women in the State was given from ₹21,000 crores, which came from the World Bank for some other project. An hour before the moral code of conduct for the polls, ₹14,000 crores were taken out and distributed to 1.25 crore women in the State, says Jan Suraaj Spokesperson Pavan Kumar

title: India's spend on Russian oil buy at €2.5 billion in October ahead of new sanctions
content: India's spending in October was unchanged from the €2.5 billion spent on buying Russian oil in September

title: Three Maoists killed in encounter with police in Chhattisgarh's Sukma
content: “The gunfight broke out in forested hills of Bhejji and Chintagufa police station areas in morning when team of DRG was out on anti-Maoist operation based on inputs about presence of Maoist cadres in region,” the SP said

title: Destruction of illegal poppy fields intensified in Manipur
content: The security forces have destroyed plants, huts, and equipment on 476 acres in five days of operation in Kangpokpi and Ukhrul districts

title: Kerala local body polls: The rise and fall of a people’s collective in Chellanam
content: In 2020, eight Independents who contested under the banner of Chellanam Twenty20 on the plank of corruption-free governance emerged victorious, making them the second-largest bloc in the 21-member hung panchayat. By the end of the term, two of its members defected to LDF and the collective disintegrated, merging with Twenty20 of Kizhakkambalam

title: Kerala local body polls: UDF, NDA hopeful of dethroning LDF in Anthoor
content: The Left front is ruling the municipality since its formation in 2015. Opponents say their activities are being stymied by the ruling coalition. CPI(M) highlights the development projects and the region’s deep ties with communism

title: Kerala local body polls: No name on voters’ list makes UDF’s  youngest candidate ineligible to contest in Thiruvananthapuram Corporation
content: An error in providing the address has resulted in the removal of her name from the electoral roll, leading to removal from voters’ list

title: Battle for Kerala’s local bodies begins
content: While LDF is looking for a repeat of 2020, when it dominated all levels of local body tiers,  UDF and NDA are looking to change the tide, eyeing upset victories, especially in crucial Corporations and municipalities

title: West Bengal: Abhishek to launch healthcare outreach initiative ‘Sebaashray 2’ from Dec 1
content: The Trinamool general secretary had in January 2025, launched the ‘Sebaashray’ an initiative under which hundreds of free medical camps were set up across his Lok Sabha constituency Diamond Harbour

title: Direct engagement ensures market linkages for rural producers in Rajasthan
content: Several leading companies signed letters of intent (LoIs) at an event in Udaipur over the weekend, expressing readiness for large-scale procurement from SHG enterprises

title: Delhi HC steps in to revive Centre’s rare-disease crowdfunding portal after lukewarm response from sponsors
content: The initiative was launched with the hope that India’s corporate sector, philanthropists, and compassionate individuals would step in to fill a life-saving gap

title: Venezuela keen to increase cooperation in critical minerals sector with India
content: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal emphasised the need to reactivate the India-Venezuela Joint Committee Mechanism

title: P. Chidambaram launches book on Indian community in  Singapore
content: At the launch held here, the first copy was received by Edgar Pang, Consul General of the Republic of Singapore in Chennai.

title: Hindustan Zinc gets licence to explore, mine tungsten block in Andhra Pradesh
content: Earlier this year, Hindustan Zinc Ltd was declared the preferred bidder through a competitive auction process conducted by the Centre

title: ‘Visit Raj Bhavan and verify’, says West Bengal Governor after TMC MP alleges arms distributed from Raj Bhavan
content: The Raj Bhawan also added if the allegations are found to be untrue then the MP Kalyan Banerjee “has the decent option to apologise to the people of Bengal and face prosecution for hate speech”

title: Our voters went with NDA out of fear that RJD will bring back jungle raj: Jan Suraaj
content: Jan Suraaj Party’s national president Uday Singh also claimed “polarisation” took place in the Seemanchal region in the aftermath of the blast near Red Fort in Delhi, a day before polling was held in the area

title: West Bengal SIR: BLOs seek deadline extension, assistance with data entry; cite ‘unmanageable workload’
content: West Bengal CEO Manoj Kumar Agarwal, along with 26 District Electoral Officers and Senior Deputy Election Commissioner Gyanesh Bharti, reviewed the progress of SIR in West Bengal

title: Turning threads
content: The Mafatlal group, once a textile behemoth, went into survival mode at the turn of the 21st century. Now, with the fifth generation at the helm, a mindset shift and some prudence, business is up, finds Lalatendu Mishra

title: Where does India stand in tackling TB? | Explained
content: What are the hurdles in eradicating tuberculosis? Why has India missed the target of being TB-free by 2025?

title: What are the threats from GNSS spoofing? | Explained
content: Why did pilots encounter manipulated Global Navigation Satellite System signals while flying over Delhi? Which institution is heading the inquiry? How do such occurrences endanger aircraft safety? What has the aviation industry been pushing for?

title: Why was there a tech glitch at Delhi airport? | Explained
content: Why did the Automatic Message Switching System fail? What happens when there’s a technical failure? How many flights did the November 6 incident affect? What are the issues that have surfaced after the incident? Which airports use the AMSS? Does it need upgrading?

title: Justice vs judgment
content: The Bangladesh tribunal, originally created for 1971 war crimes, has evolved into a tool for political justice; reconstituted after Sheikh Hasina’s fall, it now prosecutes her government’s 2024 crackdown

title: Rajenthra Bhalaji must apologise, take back his statements about Congress: Selvaperunthagai
content: In a statement to the media, the TNCC president says the senior leadership of the AIADMK must have reprimanded Mr. Bhalaji for his comments that the Congress party should be dissolved

title: Vijay encourages TVK ‘virtual warriors’ to help family, friends, and others in SIR process
content: Alleging interference from the ruling DMK in a video released on social media, Mr. Vijay claims that those from the ruling party are not giving the forms to the members of his party

title: ‘Be truthful, patriotic, and deliver on time’, CDS Gen. Chauhan tells defence industry
content: CDS warns against exaggerated claims of indigenisation, delayed product delivery, and inflated costs, saying that such practices undermine national security

title: Poll picture becomes clearer in Kozhikode
content: LDF announces candidates for 73 divisions in Corpn; UDF announces majority of candidates; BJP to complete candidate list for Corpn. as well as district panchayat on Sunday

title: Tamil Nadu moves Supreme Court against President’s refusal to grant assent to anti-NEET Bill
content: Tamil Nadu urged the Supreme Court to pronounce the President’s refusal as unconstitutional and declared that the 2021 Bill is deemed to have received assent

title: Saalumarada Thimmakka laid to rest with state honours
content: As a mark of tribute, 114 saplings will be planted and nurtured at 114 locations across Karnataka, symbolising each year of Thimmakka’s life

title: 'Rs 14K cr from World Bank funds used in Bihar polls': Jan Suraaj's big charge; Chirag hits back
content: Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj Party alleged the Bihar government diverted World Bank funds for cash transfers to women voters before elections. Spokesperson Pavan Verma claimed Rs 14,000 crore was used, tilting the electoral field. Union Minister Chirag Paswan dismissed these claims as baseless.

title: Vote share giants, seat share dwarfs: RJD's stunning Bihar polls paradox - explained
content: Bihar's 2025 election saw the RJD secure the highest vote share but a drastically low seat tally, while the NDA achieved a landslide victory. The RJD's votes were spread thinly, resulting in many second-place finishes, a consequence of India's 'First Past the Post' system. The NDA's strategic alliances and efficient vote conversion led to their dominant win.

title: Chat on WhatsApp instantly: Steps to text unsaved numbers; no new contact required
content: WhatsApp now allows users to message without saving numbers. This feature, 'Click to Chat,' lets you initiate conversations via a special link. You can even pre-fill messages. Businesses can use the official 'Chat on WhatsApp' button on their sites for easy customer contact, streamlining communication and decluttering your phone.

title: 'Facilities have been attacked': Iran reacts to Nuclear enrichment reports
content: Iran's Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi denied reports of undeclared uranium enrichment, stating that all facilities are monitored by the IAEA. He attributed the current lack of enrichment to recent attacks on its facilities, while asserting Iran's undeniable right to peaceful nuclear technology.

title: 'You deserve to lose': Ex-ENG captain's attack on Eden Gardens pitch; hails WTC champs
content: Michael Vaughan slammed the Eden Gardens pitch after India's Test defeat to South Africa, calling it 'awful'.  However, Gautam Gambhir defended the conditions, stating they were precisely what the team desired.  Despite the controversy, South Africa secured a victory within three days, highlighting the challenging nature of the surface for both sides.

title: Startup risk check: Conference votes OpenAI as 'likely to flop'; Perplexity tops survey
content: An informal survey at the Cerebral Valley AI Conference revealed industry professionals are betting against OpenAI and search startup Perplexity, ranking them as most likely to fail. Despite OpenAI's prominence, concerns over its valuation and infrastructure costs persist. Conversely, Anthropic emerged as the preferred investment, highlighting a cautious sentiment among AI founders and investors.

title: DMs and drones: Amritsar police busts Pakistan-linked arms & drugs network; five arrested
content: Amritsar police have dismantled a Pakistan-linked arms and drug network, arresting five individuals and seizing six pistols and over a kilogram of heroin. Investigations revealed the accused coordinated with handlers in Pakistan via social media and drones for smuggling operations into Punjab.  FIRs have been registered, and efforts continue to root out the entire syndicate.

title: IND vs SA: No demons? Eden surface draws fire after India’s shock defeat
content: India head coach Gautam Gambhir insisted there were “no demons” in the Eden Gardens pitch despite a two-and-a-half-day Test marked by variable bounce and sharp turn. Former greats Dale Steyn, Anil Kumble and Cheteshwar Pujara disagreed, calling the surface unfair and luck-driven. With India’s batting faltering and WTC points lost, the bigger question lingers: do pitches like these serve Test cricket at all?

title: After controversial 'bauna' remarks, Bumrah, Bavuma locked in chat; fans go berserk
content: Jasprit Bumrah and Temba Bavuma shared a composed conversation after India's 30-run defeat to South Africa, putting aside a Day 1 controversy. South Africa secured a historic Test win in India, defending 124 runs on a challenging Eden Gardens pitch. The post-match exchange signaled that there were no hard feelings between the two.

title: Mark Zuckerberg's charity insight: Researchers demanding GPUs; reject space and staff
content: Mark Zuckerberg and Priscilla Chan's philanthropic organisation, CZI, is now prioritising computing power, specifically GPUs, over physical expansion for its science and AI mission.  Researchers at Biohub are demanding more GPUs, which Chan describes as 'new lab space' that is more expensive than traditional facilities. This strategic shift aims to accelerate breakthroughs in AI-powered biology.

title: Taylor Swift reportedly rethinks wedding to Travis Kelce for a grander celebration
content: Pop superstar Taylor Swift is reportedly planning a grand wedding for Travis Kelce.  The celebration is expected to be a major cultural event, reflecting her global status.  Sources suggest a guest list of over 300, with performances from friends.  The wedding is rumored for early to mid-2026, marking a significant new chapter.

title: Ignoring own orders, Supreme Court has kept case in limbo since 2018
content: The Supreme Court is set to hear a plea to lift a seven-year-old stay on a CBI probe into tiger poaching in Corbett Tiger Reserve. The probe had suggested forest officials' connivance with poachers. The CBI itself has sought vacation of the stay, citing preliminary findings of irregularities and cover-ups. An environmentalist argues the prolonged stay hinders dismantling poaching networks.

title: India fall apart without Gill; Harmer inspires South Africa’s 30-run win
content: South Africa secured a thrilling 30-run victory over India in the first Test, with Simon Harmer's eight wickets proving decisive. India, chasing 124, faltered to 93, hampered by the absence of captain Shubman Gill due to injury. Keshav Maharaj and Aiden Markram also played key roles in the win, giving the Proteas a 1-0 series lead.

title: Bihar-UP relationship like Ram-Sita, ‘unbreakable and strong’, says UP CM Yogi
content: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath likened the bond between Uttar Pradesh and Bihar to that of Lord Ram and Sita, celebrating the NDA's landslide victory in Bihar. He inaugurated and laid foundations for 432 projects worth Rs 548 crore in Sonbhadra, emphasizing development and good governance for tribal communities.

title: Vitamin D may reduce heart attack risk: Study highlights cardiovascular benefits
content: New research suggests vitamin D supplementation may modestly reduce the risk of major cardiovascular issues, including heart attacks, particularly in older adults. While not a dramatic effect, it adds to evidence of vitamin D's broader health benefits beyond bone and immunity. This could offer an additional layer of support for long-term heart health, especially for those already managing cardiac risks.

title: 'More than skill, you need ... ': Gambhir reacts to defeat; reveals what IND lacked
content: Team India faced a disappointing 30-run loss to South Africa in Kolkata. Head coach Gautam Gambhir highlighted the young batting lineup's struggle with pressure during tough Test cricket sessions. The team must now focus on improving their temperament and building resilience ahead of the 2nd Test in Guwahati set to commence on Saturday.

title: 'Abuses hurled, slipper raised': Lalu family feud intensifies; Rohini alleges insult over transplant
content: Lalu Prasad Yadav's daughter, Rohini Acharya, has accused her brother Tejashwi Yadav of humiliation and abuse, claiming a slipper was raised to hit her. She stated she left her parents in tears to protect her dignity. This public spat follows the RJD's significant electoral defeat and a prior family rift involving Tej Pratap Yadav.

title: New Bihar cabinet: Final talks on; govt will be formed before Nov 22, says Chirag
content: The NDA is set to form the next government in Bihar swiftly, with Union minister Chirag Paswan confirming the process will conclude before November 22. This follows the NDA's decisive victory, securing 202 seats in the 243-member Assembly, with the BJP and JD(U) leading the tally.

title: Bihar election result: RJD’s numbers in Rajya Sabha to shrink sharply after poll debacle
content: The NDA's strong Bihar election win positions them to claim all Rajya Sabha seats from the state in upcoming biennial polls. This will significantly reduce the RJD's representation in the Upper House, as opposition parties lack the necessary MLA numbers to secure seats in 2026 and 2028. The NDA is set to bolster its numbers in the Rajya Sabha.

title: Govt’s e-Jagriti portal resolves over 1.27 lakh cases; NRIs benefit from global access
content: The government's e-Jagriti platform has successfully resolved nearly 1.30 lakh consumer grievances since its January launch, with over 2 lakh users, including NRIs, registering. The unified system, featuring multilingual support and digital tools, has significantly improved redressal efficiency nationwide. NRIs can now file complaints remotely, with the US leading in such cases.

title: IND vs SA: Unbeaten in 11 matches! Bavuma yet to lose a Test as South Africa captain
content: South Africa secured a significant 30-run victory over India in the opening Test, marking their first win in the country in 15 years. India's batting struggled against quality spin, being bowled out for 93 while chasing 124. This result extends Proteas captain Temba Bavuma's impressive unbeaten run. It was India’s fourth home defeat in their last six Tests.

title: With prices on boil, Trump lowers duties on tea, spices
content: US President Donald Trump has lowered import duties on nearly 200 food and agricultural items, including spices and tea, to ease rising domestic prices. This move provides a significant boost to India's key agri exports, though seafood and basmati rice remain under tariff sanctions. The exemptions aim to create a level playing field for Indian products in the US market.

title: Bihar election result: PM Modi's 'gamcha' moment steals show after NDA sweeps state
content: Prime Minister Modi's arrival at the BJP office, sporting a local gamcha and stole, became a viral cultural moment following Bihar's election results. This visual, coupled with the phrase "garda uda diya," resonated deeply, symbolizing his connection with the state.  BJP leaders highlighted Modi's consistent ability to embrace local culture, turning a political victory into a shared celebration.

title: Tear gas, chaos, and straw hats: Gen Z protests erupt in Mexico — watch
content: Thousands protested drug violence and President Sheinbaum's security policies in Mexico City, with many carrying the 'One Piece' pirate flag. The demonstration, organized by 'Generation Z,' saw clashes with police outside the National Palace. Protesters honored assassinated Mayor Carlos Manzo, though his widow distanced herself from the event.

title: ‘This is what we wanted’: Gambhir lashes out at pitch critics after defeat
content: South Africa achieved a historic 30-run victory over India in the opening Test, marking their first win on Indian soil in 15 years. India's batting faltered against quality spin, collapsing for 93 while chasing 124. Stand-in captain Rishabh Pant admitted pressure got to the team, despite coach Gautam Gambhir defending the pitch.

title: 62-year-old man dies after being stung 890 times by bees; son escapes with injuries
content: A 62-year-old retired headmaster, Nirmal Dutta, died after being stung by an estimated 890 bees near Durgapur's Major Park. He was attacked while stopping to help his son, who was initially stung. Despite rescue by police and hospital treatment, Dutta succumbed to his injuries on Friday.

title: 'I love Sajan': Hours before marriage, bride-to-be killed by fiancé in Gujarat
content: A 22-year-old woman was found murdered in her fiancé's house in Bhavnagar, hours before their wedding. The fiancé, Sajan Baraiya, is the prime suspect and is missing after the brutal attack. The couple, who were in a live-in relationship, had reportedly argued the previous night.

title: 'This was what Gambhir's Team wanted': Ganguly on Kolkata Test pitch controversy
content: The India-South Africa Test at Eden Gardens is heading for a swift conclusion, with all innings falling short of 200 runs. Former captain Sourav Ganguly revealed the pitch was prepared to the Indian team's preference, with a lack of watering contributing to its rapid deterioration.

title: Which Vitamin is called anti-cancer vitamin, and why its deficiency is linked to the disease
content: Vitamin D comes from three sources: the sunshine that reaches our skin, the foods we eat, and the supplements we take. Getting a dose-whether via safe sun exposure, food, or a pill, helps maintain vitamin D levels at a sweet spot, that’s been linked to better cancer outcomes. Research shows that a consistent daily regimen, outperforms occasional high‑dose bursts when it comes to lowering cancer mortality.

title: WB SLST 2025 interview list released for over 20k candidates: Details here
content: West Bengal's teacher recruitment drive is advancing with the WBSSC releasing its preliminary interview list for 20,500 Higher Secondary assistant teacher hopefuls. Document verification and interviews commence November 18, 2025, as part of a massive recruitment effort aiming to fill over 35,000 teaching posts across secondary and higher secondary schools by December 2025.

title: 'Such actions will only fuel anger': Omar Abdullah on demolition of Dr Umar’s house
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah condemned the demolition of a Delhi "suicide bomber's" family home, questioning its effectiveness in combating terrorism.  Security forces razed the two-storey house in Pulwama, sparking criticism from PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti and NC MP Aga Ruhullah Mehdi, who labelled it "collective punishment" and an act of cruelty during harsh winter conditions.

title: UFC 322 results & highlights: Makhachev wins welterweight title, ties Silva’s streak
content: Islam Makhachev showcased sheer dominance, effortlessly securing the UFC welterweight title against Jack Della Maddalena. His strategic wrestling and striking overwhelmed his opponent for five rounds.  Meanwhile, Valentina Shevchenko successfully defended her flyweight crown.  The event also featured a swift knockout by Benoît Saint Denis and impressive wins from Michael Morales and Carlos Prates.

title: ‘Catch me if you can’ killer executed by firing squad in South Carolina
content: Stephen Bryant was executed by firing squad in South Carolina on Friday for three murders committed in 2004. This marks the first firing squad execution in the US in 15 years, as lethal injection remains the dominant method. The nation saw 43 executions this year, the highest since 2012.

title: 'Pathetic, utter nonsense': Ex-India cricketer slams Eden pitch
content: Former India spinner has strongly criticized the Eden Gardens pitch used for the India-South Africa Test, deeming it unfit for the longest format after a significant number of wickets fell within two days. He believes such conditions damage Test cricket's value and are a disservice to the game, making it impossible for even top batsmen to perform.

title: RSS-linked youth shot dead in Firozpur; family says murder was planned to create chaos
content: A relative of the deceased, Naveen, alleges his murder was a planned act to incite city-wide chaos. Naveen, whose father and grandfather were senior RSS workers, was shot by two assailants while returning home from his shop. The hospital declared him brought dead, suggesting he may have died instantly.

title: How 39,000-year-old ancient RNA from a mammoth found in Siberia reveals its biology
content: Scientists have recovered ancient RNA from a 39,000-year-old woolly mammoth in Siberia, offering an unprecedented glimpse into its biology.  Preserved by permafrost, the RNA reveals gene activity related to muscle, cell maintenance, and stress, providing insights into the Ice Age giant's life and cellular functions. This discovery highlights the remarkable endurance of biomolecules and the potential of frozen archives.

title: Meet Dharmendra's daughter-in-law Deepti Bhatnagar
content: Deepti Bhatnagar, a member of the Deol family, pursued a different path than her acting relatives. After a brief stint in Bollywood and Hollywood, she found her true passion in travel. Bhatnagar produced popular travel shows and now creates content for travel enthusiasts as a YouTuber. Her journey showcases a successful evolution beyond the silver screen.

title: Shocked & scared for life: Blasts take a toll on mental health too
content: A devastating blast near Red Fort has left a deep psychological scar, impacting survivors, families, and first responders. Experts highlight the isolation of victims and the amplified trauma from graphic online visuals, especially for children. The incident triggers classic trauma responses, making everyday spaces feel threatening and demanding long-term mental health support.

title: Why did 28 blackbucks die at Belagavi zoo in 3 days?
content: Twenty-eight blackbucks have died at Belagavi's Rani Channamma Mini Zoo in three days, with preliminary investigations pointing to a bacterial infection. Forest Minister Eshwar Khandre has ordered a probe by experts and instructed zoo staff to isolate the remaining animals to prevent further spread of the disease.

title: Bihar polls similar to those seen in North Korea, Russia & China, says Digvijaya Singh
content: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh raised eyebrows by likening the Bihar election results to political scenarios in North Korea, Russia, and China, suggesting that dubious practices may have influenced the outcome.

title: Delhi car blast: How video grabs from 50 CCTVs helped track Umar’s movements
content: Fresh CCTV footage reveals car bomber Umar Un Nabi using two phones and visiting a tea shop before the Red Fort blast.  Investigators tracked his movements across Delhi, including visits to Mayur Vihar and Connaught Place, before he reached the Red Fort parking lot.  The blast's impact was felt even at the metro station.

title: Chief Justice Gavai Backs Exclusion Of Creamy Layer In Reservation To Scheduled Castes
content: Chief Justice of India BR Gavai on Sunday affirmed that he is still for exclusion of creamy layer in reservations to Scheduled Castes.

title: Security Measures Heightened In Central Delhi, 34 Unattended Vehicles Seized
content: In the aftermath of the Red Fort blast that killed 13 people, the central district has intensified anti-terror measures across key stretches of the national capital.

title: Man Gets 20 Years Of Rigorous Imprisonment For Raping Girl In Tripura
content: A court in Tripura's Khowai district has sentenced a man to 20 years of rigorous imprisonment for raping a girl six years ago, a police statement said on Sunday.

title: How Jeffrey Epstein Helped Israel Establish A Police State In This Country
content: When a West African nation teetered on the edge of chaos, two unlikely figures moved behind the scenes to shape its future. One was Jeffrey Epstein, infamous financier and convicted sex offender.

title: Woman, 2 Children Found Dead In Gujarat, Husband Suspected: Cops
content: The bodies of a Gujarat forest official's wife and their two children were recovered in Bhavnagar on Sunday ten days after they went missing, police said.

title: Bihar Polls' Mahabharat And The Role Of Two Sanjays
content: In the unfolding drama of the Bihar elections, which ended in a big victory for the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) and a humiliating defeat for the Mahagathbandhan, there is an inside story of two election warriors, two contrasting personalities.

title: BJP's "Patriarchal, Anti-Woman Mentality" Jibe Over Lalu Yadav Family Feud
content: The BJP has ripped into the "patriarchal mentality" of Lalu Yadav's family after the RJD patriarch's daughter was allegedly harassed by her family members and held responsible for the party's devastating loss in the recent elections.

title: 'No Terrorist Angle In Nowgam Police Station Blast': J&K Governor
content: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha on Sunday ruled out any terrorist involvement in the Nowgam Police Station blast, stating that preliminary inputs indicate it was an accident that occurred during sample-collection work.

title: Woman Found Murdered Near Delhi Railway Station, Probe Underway: Cops
content: A middle-aged woman was found murdered near the Delhi's Adarsh Nagar Railway Station on Sunday, police said.

title: "Insult To My Sister Is Unbearable": Tej Pratap On Lalu Yadav Family Feud
content: Tej Pratap, the estranged son of Lalu Yadav, has made strong remarks after his sister Rohini Acharya made sensational allegations against her family.

title: Indian Man Is This Country's 'Top Worker'. Here's What He Won In Prize Money
content: A Kerala man, based in Abu Dhabi, has won the Outstanding Workforce' category at the Emirates Labour Market Awards, one of the UAE's highest recognitions for employees.

title: On Camera, Man Threatens Cab Driver With Gun Over Double Booking In Delhi
content: A Delhi man allegedly threatened a cab driver with what appeared to be a gun in the middle of Laxmi Nagar's crowded market. The confrontation, captured on camera, shows the man dressed in a kurta and jeans, holding what looks like a pistol

title: "Brave Officer, Was Good In Studies": Family Of Cop Killed In J&K Blast
content: Inspector Asrar Ahmad Shah of the Jammu and Kashmir Police was one of the nine people killed in the accidental blast inside the Nowgam Police Station on Friday. Asrar, 38, was a resident of Kupwara.

title: Bride-To-Be Killed By Fiance Hour Before Wedding After Fight Over Saree
content: A woman was allegedly killed by her fiance inside their house in Gujarat's Bhavnagar city, an hour before the couple was to get married on Saturday, police said.

title: Maharashtra Teen Changes Instagram Bio To "End Is Beginning", Dies By Suicide
content: An 18-year-old boy from Maharashtra's Solapur died by suicide after posting a "end is beginning" note on Instagram.

title: A "Dirty Kidney" Bombshell As Lalu Yadav's Daughter Severs Ties With Family
content: The feud within RJD patriarch Lalu Yadav's family appears to grow wider after the election setback, with his daughter Rohini Acharya making fresh allegations against her relatives.

title: NDA Finalises Bihar Power-Sharing: Who May Get What
content: The BJP is likely to have a greater representation in the new Bihar government even as Janata Dal (United) leader Nitish Kumar will remain Chief Minister, sources familiar with the details pertaining to the crucial cabinet formation said on Sunday.

title: "More Or Less Consensual": Thane Court Acquits Man In Minor's Rape Case
content: A Thane court has acquitted a man accused of raping a girl alleged to be a minor, citing insufficient evidence to establish her age and observing that the relationship appeared to be "more or less consensual in nature."

title: Intel: Could Elee flip? Texas A&M and Miami making moves
content: atop the 2026 class, multiple programs are stepping up their efforts to flip five-star Maryland defensive end commit Zion Elee . Miami , Ohio State , Ole Miss and Texas A&M are each set to host coveted flip targets in week 12 . the market, led by Penn State decommit Davion Brown, is bubbling .

title: UFC 322 takeaways: Makhachev dominates, Prates shows off at MSG
content: Islam Makhachev becomes the new welterweight champion after putting on a wrestling clinic . a few weeks ago he felt he was about 60% to 70% of himself at lightweight because of the drastic weight cut . the undisputed flyweight queen beats Zhang Weili (1:08)

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 11
content: this column features score projections, over/unders, win probabilities and, of course, easy digestible fantasy advice for seasonlong leagues and DFS . we have folded the Shadow Reports, previously a separate column, into the game-by-game breakdowns here .

title: In Skaggs court case, Angels' challenges mount
content: the wrongful death lawsuit against the los Angeles Angels continues to focus on the team's handling of Kay's drug addiction treatment and whether officials did enough to protect Skaggs . witnesses testified that Kay distributed more than 600 opioid pills to Kay over several years before learning how addictive the pills .

title: Can defending champion Orlando make it to another final?
content: the four most recent NWSL champions are also the 2025 semifinalists . Gotham defeated the no. 1-seeded Kansas City Current 2-1 in extra time . the Spirit, champions in 2021, lost last year's final to Orlando .

title: 😈 Arizona, Texas A&M top Week 12 CFB trolls
content: the wildcats went down 14-7 in the first quarter, but scored 20 points in the second half, pulling ahead for good on a 50-yard touchdown run by Kedrick Reescano . south Carolina was up 30-3 over no. 3 Texas A&M at halftime .

title: 14 more Week 11 games, 14 matchup previews: Predictions and picks
content: quarterbacks and quarterbacks play each other in an NFC West showdown . fantasy analyst Eric Moody shares fantasy football intel . givv is a betting nugget for each matchup . we have the football power index (FPI) game projections .

title: USMNT player ratings: 9/10 Reyna impresses in return
content: Mauricio Pochettino recalls Gio Reyna into his squad for friendlies against paraguay and Uruguay . he was making his first start since July 2024 . in the 10th minute, Alex Arce leveled the scoreline through a headed effort of his own .

title: 2026 World Cup: Only a 15-goal loss to Turkey will keep Spain out
content: the 2026 world cup begins on Oct. 12, 2023, when countries from the Asian confederation played their first round of matches . a total of 45 nations will join the world cup hosts united states , Mexico and canada to make up the field of 48 .

title: 'Thank you for staying with us': Mike Elko leads best quips of Week 12 in college football
content: Texas A&M trailed 30-3 in the first half to complete the largest comeback in school history . this week, another batch of coaches brought their team's momentum off the field to their postgame media availability . the gamecocks raced out to a 30-3 lead before the break, before the Aggies stormed back .

title: The SEC offered a dose of playoff football in Week 12
content: the 2025 season has been more bluster than reality . the balance of power seems to sway like an LSU fan after a 12-hour tailgate . it's the perfect showcase for this heart-pounding reality, with a team's fortunes waning .

title: Projecting Tuesday's CFP top 12: Where do the Sooners and Tide land?
content: the college football playoff selection committee's third ranking is guaranteed to look different Tuesday night . the biggest question is how the two-loss teams will stack up . assuming the committee rewards Oklahoma's head-to-head win against the Tide, the duo will likely be a package deal .
